result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah Jean Jarosz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah Jean Jarosz

records.addlTxt: Move $250.00 from 22CF240 to 22CF444. sf

3:30 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: M. Olson, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Sarah Jean Jarosz in court.  Attorney John Joseph Leunig in court for Sarah Jean Jarosz.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF444, 22CF240, 22CF304, 22CF309, & 22CF537.  ADA Rockow states there is an agreement and recites recommendation. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 3- Possess w/Intent THC in 22CF444.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 in 22CF444.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2, & 4-6 in 22CF444, Court dismissed and read in Cts 1-3 and outright dismiss Ct 4 in 22CF240 (bond money $250), Court outright dismissed 22CF304 (bond money $250), 22CF309, & 22CF537. Sentencing arguments. Atty Leunig submits 4 letters to the court for review. 

Court Orders: Ct 3 in 22CF444

S/W 3 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
 Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Maintain current program of recovery
- Absolute sobriety
- Test randomly through program or agent
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to debrief to Law Enforcement of who her resources were
- 60 days county jail- STAYED
- Sign up for probation by Monday 10/10/22 at 4:00 PM
- Pay supervision fees

Court reserves on credit for time served due by Tuesday 10/11/22. 

Adjourned at 4:12 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF444 (PH), 22CF240, 22CF304, 22CF309, 22CF537- remaining files are set for PTC.  As to case 22CF444-  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE updates address and phone number.  Court orders attorneys to go to JA's office to schedule PLEAS.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:09 PM. bph

Per SRN. Fax: SCSO, Dispatch, Jail.  gll

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF304, 22CF309, 22CF240.

- $500.00 on file.

- Defendant to have baseline test prior to release.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nicholas B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Court SUSPENDS testing at JSC until 7/18/22, but if DE enters in-patient treatment and provides verification of in-patient treatment, Court will continue suspension of testing.

- Defendant to sign appropriate release of information for Justice Support Center while in treatment.

- If Defendant leaves the treatment facility against staff approval or upon completion of treatment, Defendant to report immediately to Justice Support Center.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
